Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, probably an amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of legs and foot of male to right, with added purple and added white clothing at groin, crossed with foot of another male running to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

A different sherd is listed in the Ashmolean Museum's register and in the CVA Oxford II, 94, pl. II, no. 23 as AN1896-1908-G.563. Since the registration number on this sherd was written in pencil, it is likely that this is a misidentification, which also casts potential doubt on this fragment being from Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0074) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
